results.name: BBC News
results.description:
I am currently the development lead for the BBC News front page rebuild. Working closely with other teams around the BBC, I have helped work towards creating a library of reusable components which are easily accessible via an internal open source model. These components are so far in use by BBC Sport, BBC Weather, and BBC Live.

Previous to the front page project, I lead a small team in redesigning the BBC News build pipeline using Jenkins and Docker. I have developed and still maintain several workflow and productivity tools used by developers in BBC News. I have also worked for BBC World Service where I assisted in the rollout of dozens of responsive web sites, and helped to architect & build the BBC's new cloud-based feed aggregation service.

results.name: Rightster
results.description:
At Rightster I helped to architect and build the front-end for the company's video distribution platform. We used Zend Framework 2 as a domain logic & presentation layer, and made extensive use of AngularJS to build rich user interfaces.

The project consisted of over 20,000 lines of JavaScript, which we managed by adhering to a solid architecture around small, well-tested components.

results.name: Time Inc. UK
results.description: At Time Inc. I worked on building out a new API-driven mobile web site platform. During this project I became interested in automated testing as a way to improve the quality of our products. I wrote a smoke test tool which uses PhantomJS to check for common page-level errors, and takes a screenshot of each page to aid manual visual checks. This helped catch bugs quickly, and enabled us to deploy the platform several times a day with confidence. I also introduced JavaScript unit testing to the engineering department and encouraged more automated testing during the monthly developer gathering. The slides from my talk are available here.

results.name: Chroma
results.description:
Working in a small close-knit team I atchitected and built a web interface used by bookmakers around the UK to monitor and set pricing in real time. To support legacy browsers, I chose to implement a long polling mechanism to achieve the "real time" functionality.

I also worked closely with Chroma's clients to create bespoke modules for the ExpressionEngine CMS, including an interface for managing email campaigns using the Campaign Monitor API, and a membership management tool for Racing UK Club.

results.name: Zeevo
results.description: Using the CodeIgniter PHP framework and Doctrine ORM, I helped to build a booking and scheduling system used by tourism operators around New Zealand. I was also involved in architecting and building a secure file sharing application using the Dropbox API.
